intro: Rubia petiolaris var. isophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leafed madder, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Its roots are known for containing alkaloids and have been used historically in traditional medicine. The leaves and stems are often harvested for their medicinal properties and dyeing potential.
